mdRecord.dcterms:title: The Turkish Empire in Europe, Asia and Africa divided into all its governments: together with the other territories that are tributary to it, as also the dominions of ye Emperor of Marocco ; according to the newest and most exact observations / by H. Moll Geographer
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Moll, Herman, -1732 [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 1 map : col. ; 60 x 101 cm. on sheet 63 x 107 cm.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Dedication: To the honourable Tho. Vernon Esqr. one of ye Commissrs. of Trade for ye Plantations, of His Majesty of Gr. Britain. This map is most humbly dedicated by your most Humble Servant Her. Moll Geographer. [original]
Originally issued, with a variant imprint, after the ascension of George I in 1714, based on the reference to "His Majesty" in the Dedication. [original]

Insets: Plan of Constantinople -- Draught of the City of Jerusalem as it is now, taken from the south east by Corneille Le Bruyn -- Church of the Holy Sepulcre (3 views), J. Harris, fecit. -- Smirna. [original]
Prime meridians: London and Ferro Island. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: "Turkish Empire & Morocco" handwritten in brown ink on verso, with a smear over "Morocco." [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Turkey--Maps--Early works to 1800
